captions.text: (TL;DR Music)

(A TUBA GOES: DA DA DA DA DA DA DA 
 DA, DA DA DA DA DA DA DA DA)

(TUBA, SYNTH GO: DA DA DA DA DA DA DA 
 DA, DA DA DA DA DA DA DA DA)
[M] Spudgy from South Korea asks,

[Sp] "Mom, where did you go for your birthday, and 
 why didn't you you take me, Mom?
Signed, the Spudgy. Dear Mom, I love you, my mom."
[S] Spudgy, that guy is so bad at writing. [Sp] I love my mom.
[S] Spudgy used the Siri. [Sp] Siri, tell my mom, I love my mom.
[Siri, with the robotic-like voice] Sorry Spudgy, I do not understand.

[M] So, some of you maybe wondering why we 
 are taking Spudgy's request over someone else's request.
[S] Now the reason why, is because we've decided to abandon the Google moderator.

[M] For those of you who don't know, Google moderator 
 is where we were choosing our TL;DR questions from.
The top rated, most popular question was the one we answered.
But, recently we discovered that we couldn't actually go in
and adjust anything, so the same like top eight questions

that were voted up the most popular, remained at 
 the top, and we couldn't delete them.

[S] So now, pretty much our Google moderator page is 
 like twenty pages of questions we've already answered.

So from now on, if you want to ask us a question for our next TL;DR, just 
 do so in the comments to this Youtube video
(OMG! I'm leaving a question for myself!)
or on our blog post. That's it. (Ooo, leaving sassy questions for a TL;DR)

[M] And, we'll be choosing our favorite question: it could 
 be about us, it could be about Korea.

[S] It could be about chocolate bars. It could be 
 about Spudgy's stow hairs, anything you want,

be it silly or serious. We're ready to answer 
 them because TL;DRs are back in full effect.

[M] (Baby voice) On wednesdays. So we decided to 
 get rid of the KCrunch Cocktail on thursdays

because we were just doing too many videos, 
 and we couldn't keep up with TL;DRs.
We know you guys like them, so back to Spudgy's question.
[Sp] Mom, where were you, Mom?

[M] Incapable. [S] This winds up answering a second question of 
 why we are not doing a WANK this week,

which Martina has a very guilty conscious for, and she's 
 going to answer in a very ashamed manner.
But, we should probably start from the beginning.
[M] So, what did I do for my birthday?

My birthday was great. I read a lot of amazing messages online, 
 which made me feel warm and fumbly on the inside.

And then, Simon had a whole bunch of 
 special gifts for me like vanilla beans.

Everyone's like that's a pretty lame gift. But it's 
 really difficult to find vanilla beans in Korea!

[S] I had to take like a 40 hour taxi drive just, not 
 40 hour, 40 minute taxi drive just to get the vanilla beans.

[M] And, he got me a hand mixer as 
 well because I really love to cook.

You can't find hand mixers at like the E-Mart or local stores, 
 so Simon had to go to a little specialty place.

[S] See, I feel bad because it's like those are the kinds of 
 lame gifts [M] housewife gifts [S] gifts that you give a housewife,

like here you go wife, I got you a hand mixer and a 
 vacuum and an apron, so that you can clean around the house
while I watch football games. It's not like that. Ok?
[M] He is like... no. [S] Cooking is a hobby for my wife.

[M] He also got me an iPad holder, so that I 
 can cook in the kitchen with my iPad holder. Hahaha.

[S] You had your eyes on it the whole time, 
 you would be like, oh, I want that.

It was sold out. I went very far distances to 
 get that for you as well. [M] Hahahaha.
[S] Do you understand the effort?

[M] Listen, it's not just for cooking, it's good so when I call my 
 family and I'm cooking, I can chat with my family in the kitchen.
[S] This story is starting to suck.

[M] Ok, skip that part. So Simon makes plans for us to go to 
 the W Hotel in Gangnam, which is a really beautiful, very artsy-like hotel.

Side note: We have a friend, who is friends with a 
 friend of a friend, who works at the W Hotel,

and claims to see TOP eating in the restaurant there quite 
 often, by himself, all lonely with a glass of wine.
(Both sing 2NE1's "Lonely") I'm so lonely, lonely lonely, lonely lonely.
[S] And after like five glasses of wine, it's boom shakalaka. (Both laugh)
[M] Anyways, this was all a suprise. Simon was very elaborate with making everything.

He even had the taxi driver not mention where we are going, have the 
 GPS off. He ended up blindfolding me as we approached the hotel,

when I was getting of the highway so I wouldn't 
 know where we were. I was very honestly suprised.

And, he booked some awesome full body massages, full facials, 
 and awesome things that were relaxing like that.

[S] Now, what's amazing about this is that, from our 
 experience of massages in Korea, 
(Martina cries on camera!)

they feel like water torture. It's just so excruciatingly painful, so we hate 
 it.        (Note the eyebrow pain)

So, I made sure that when I booked these massages, I was like, "Look. I've had many massages 
 in Korea. They hurt me a lot. I will not pay you if you hurt me."

[M] Anyways, I didn't know I was getting a massage. It was 
 still part of the birthday suprise. [S] She knew nothing whatsoever.

[M] So, Simon just rushed us up to our hotel room, which 
 was really beautiful, had a gorgeous look out of Seoul.

And said, alright. Drop your stuff, we gotta go somewhere else, 
 missy. And I was like, oh my god, confusion.

Then we separated into the male and female spa area, but something a 
 little different happened then what we are used to in North America.

[S] So, when I walk into the changing room, they give me 
 a locker and they're like, "Put your clothes in there."

I'm like ok, do you have like shorts or something that i could change 
 into, like a robe? And they're like, no, put your clothes in there.

So you want me to walk around naked? You know, swinging around 
 for everyone to see and they're like, "Yeah, naked, go."

And I'm like, can I have a towel at least? "Ok, here, 
 you you sissy foreigner. (Sounds of a baby crying )
Take your towel. (Martina laughs) And don't do things the Korean way."
But like, everyone was just walking around naked.

[M] Anyways, the time came for our massage treatment and so, someone came out to get me and brought 
 me into a room and at this point I still had no idea what was going on.

So, I'm just in my little robe, and 
 I'm like, where are you taking me?

I end up in a room with a ginormous copper bathtub 
 with rose petals scattered everywhere and weird spa music playing.
You know, like... (Martina imitates soothing spa music)

(Simon makes the sounds of "Circle of Life" song from the 
 Disney movie "The Lion King".)  Circle Of Life!
[M] Ok, that was not playing there, Simon. [S] Oh.

[M] Ok, so I'm standing here, being like, I don't know what 
 to do here. Am I supposed to take a bath?
And then they bring Simon in. So, I'm like, ok.

Now, Simon's here and we're standing in a room with a 
 giant bathtub, and I don't know what to do.
And, they're like, "Here. Take these and put them on."

I look at it and it's a pair of like 
 bathing suit underpants for me, and Simon has...

[S] They gave me a pair of underwear as 
 well. Except I wouldn't exactly call them underwear.

It was more like, imagine the bottom of 
 a potato sack cut with leg holes.

And it was just like, I put it on, it was just 
 like this big, puffy diaper. [M] It looked like a diaper.
Just like sagging in the front, sagging in the back.

There was nothing nice or comfortable about it, and I just...
[M] 
 But, it was hilarious because mine was all fitted,

so I was like oooo, I'm in my bathing suit. [S] I just 
 wish they had a different fabric apart from potato sack fabric.

Like, would you like cotton, would you like nylon, or would you 
 like potato sack? (Snaps fingers) I'll go for the potato sack!

[M] Anyways, we had the chance to enjoy a deep soak in the bathtub together, 
 with the most ginormous Viking bathtub I have ever seen in my life.

After we were all loosened up and warm, they let us 
 into the other room where we started our couple massage.

[S] Anyhow, I think Martina is stalling a bit because 
 she's ashamed about what happened in the evening.

So, let's just say that our massages were awesome. Our dinner was delicious 
 and awesome. [M] You're skipping there so quickly, I'm not ready. (panics)

[S] Well, you better tell them what happened afterwards, or 
 our little cocktail bar incident. [M] Oh.

So we went for cocktails at Nighttime, and Simon had bought me a really 
 lovely birthday hat that I had to wear for the whole night.

And right beside us, there was some kind of like afterparty going on, and we weren't 
 sure what it was for, but looked like some kind of fashion week celebration

because they were showing pictures of like models. So, eventually 
 my birthday hat seemed to gather some attention.

(This guy! Super nice, great dancer!)
So this one guy, he came down the 
 stairs, he came over to serenade me because it was my birthday.

And he was like "Birthday girl! Birthday girl! Birthday girl!" 
 And he did like this awesome birthday girl dance.

[S] It wasn't really serenade as much as just like ah... [M] Like 
 a jig. [S] Hey, everyone look over, here's a birthday girl. [M] Yeah.

And then he brought us some pink champagne, so I 
 was like, "Aw, thank you you so much."

I felt obliged to drink the champagne. And then, they brought over 
 more shots, and then they brought over more pink  champagne,

and then we found out that the guy that was running 
 it, it was his birthday on May the second.
Then they were like, "Birthday girl. Birthday boy. Birthday girl. Birthday boy."

[S] So, what originally started off as being a very responsible night of enjoying 
 some Martini's and speaking with each other lovingly, (Not really. Martina is bad.)

turns out that Martina got a lot more alcohol than we had planned on ingesting, and 
 she was drinking it for the sake of the birthday party they were throwing us
and throwing for themselves.

[M] And what's funny about it is how fame is kind of a relative thing, 
 because supposedly we were introduced to some really famous like Thai actors and models,

and Singapore actors and Singapore models. But, we didn't actually know any 
 of them because we're not into that culture right now?

[S] So, I'm sure a lot of you are gonna be 
 like, OH MY GOD! You partied with blankety blank!

And I'm like, I don't know who that 
 is.
(But yes, everyone was REALLY super nice!)
[M] I don't know who blankety blank is. [Both] Sorry guys!

[S] Anyhow, the moral of the story isn't about being famous, the moral of the story 
 is, do not drink at a Singaporean fashion party because they will mess you up.

[M] I think the the moral of the story is don't mix your champange with your 
 cocktails and with shots and with more cocktails and with cake, so much cake.

I had lots of cake. So, needless to say, the next morning 
 I wasn't feeling very good. (Sad Panda, Martina is Sad...)

[S] And by next morning, I think you mean to say, morning, afternoon, and 
 evening. You were pretty much...
(but happy with her new b-day iPad case!)

[M] My tummy felt really queasy. [S] You were 
 bedridden for the rest of the day.

So, Wednesdays are usually the day that we wind up filming our 
 Faps and our Wank Wanks (Ha, it's FapFaps and WANKS, guys)
and because Martina was so sick, we couldn't film anything.

So if you have any free time on your hands, feel free to 
 complain to the Singaporean fashion people for ruining our WANKing adventures.
(Dramatic piano) [M] I couldn't WANK because I had too much champagne.

But, despite feeling a little bit sick the next day, I really had an 
 amazing birthday: really great wishes from you guys, awesome birthday gifts from Simon,

awesome plans from the best husband ever! [S] Thanks sunshine. [M] You're 
 such a great husband, I'm so lucky that I found you.

How did I trick you into marrying me? [S] I tricked you, missy.
[M] I 
 tricked you. [S] I tricked you so good. [M] I tricked you.

[S] I suckered you. [M] I suckered you. [S] I'm like, 
 will you marry me? You said yes. Bwah ha ha.
So, that's it for this week's TL;DR.

If you have a question for next TL;DR, leave it in the 
 comments section below, either on YouTube or on our blog page.

[M] And don't forget to check out the questions that are already 
 asked, because if you don't want to ask a question,

maybe there's a question you love, and you can 
 thumbs that up and get our attention.

[S] And don't forget to like and favorite this 
 video and to subscribe for more TL:DR Wednesdays.

[M] That's right. Remember we moved them from thursday to  wednesdays, and 
 we're not gonna drink any more pink champagne ever! [S] With Singaporeans.
(Dramatic piano) [M] Or vodka. [S] With Singaporeans. [M] Or Long Island Iced Teas.
[S] We should just not drink with Singaporeans. [M] Or strawberry martini's.

[S] I'm sorry Singapore. I don't mean all of you, just 
 your fashion people. (Whispers) Fashion people scare me.
(Gong and sexy "Intoxication" music) Thanks for watching EYK's TL;DR!
